description: Many music trackers released in the 1980s save songs that users create as SNG files. These files contain MIDI data, rather than actual audio. The music tracker that created the file can load the SNG file to play the song it defines, using various instrument samples .
Some music trackers that create SNG files include:
Often, other MIDI-compatible devices can play SNG files. But in some cases, only the program that created an SNG file can play the song it defines.

images.alt: Screenshot of a .sng file in n-Track Studio 9
images.caption: SNG file open in n-Track Studio 9
